@graph.text: Do you opt for low-sodium soy sauce?

headline: Easy Pad Thai
name: Easy Pad Thai
recipeInstructions: In a large pot of salted boiling water, cook noodles until al dente. Drain.  In a small bowl, whisk together lime juice, brown sugar, fish sauce, soy sauce, and cayenne pepper. Set aside. In a large nonstick pan over medium-high heat, heat oil. Add bell pepper and cook until tender, about 4 minutes. Stir in garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute more. Add the shrimp and season with salt and pepper. Cook until pink, about 2 minutes per side. Push the shrimp and vegetables to one side of the pan and pour in the egg. Scramble until just set then mix with the shrimp mixture. Add the cooked noodles and toss until combined. Pour in the lime juice mixture and toss until the noodles are coated. Garnish with green onions and roasted peanuts before serving.

video.description: Pad Thai Is The Perfect Quick and Easy Weeknight Dinner
video.name: Skip The Take Out And Make Pad Thai Tonight

review.reviewBody: Loved this recipe. I made a few adjustments, but I’m sure it is great as is too! I make mine with chicken, and I sautéed the green onions with the garlic for some extra flavor. I also like more suave so I doubled the sauce recipe. And added an extra egg for some extra protein. It is decently spicy so I cut the cayenne in half for my kids. My husband, 6 year old and 3 year old can’t get enough and everyone has seconds. Delicious recipe- thank you so much for sharing!

I have made this a couple of times. It is very good but great with a couple small modifications.I added sugar snap peas ( steamed a bit) to give it crunch and color. Like others I added a little peanut butter ( not too much! it goes a long way. you can add more later if needed. No way is the prep time 10 minutes...more like 20. But once prepped it takes about 10 minutes to cook.

This is not a traditional Pad Thai, start with that attitude and you’ll love this recipe. Made this last night and it was so good. Your recipe allowed me to feel okay about substitutions... no bean sprouts was good! I didn’t have tamarind (I’m in my RV) so I used balsamic vinegar and extra lime juice. I did not boil the rice noodles, they do not need it. Just soaked them in hot water. Thanks, delish!

This was good! I think next time I'll cut back on the cayenne as it was a touch too spicy for me. I would definitely recommend increasing the amount of sauce to 1.5x or 2x the amount that it calls for.

I doubled the sauce and peanuts, left out the cayenne, and added sriracha and extra lime juice for more flavor. The recipe was pretty bland on it's own. But after adding a little more it was fantastic! And dont forget the cilantro!!
I cooked this tonight and add a little ginger it was awesome
This was quick & easy for a weeknight meal. Great flavors too. I added some peas & carrots.
Amazing recipe! We added carrots and did chicken instead of shrimp, so yummy!
Great recipe and so easy to make on a weekday for the family
Delicious. Definitely make more sauce. Do not use the whole pack of noodles if it’s a 1lb pack.
I replace the fish sauce (too fishy for me!) with Oyster sauce, and it's great!
This is a great recipe that even my finicky children loved!
i love this it tastes AMAZING
While the outcome tasted good, this tastes nothing like pad Thai. I know pad Thai and this is not it. Don’t advertise a recipe if it’s not that.
My go-to recipe for Pad Thai. Love it as it’s not too saucy and has lots of flavour!

description: This quick and easy stir fried noodle dish is one that any beginner cook can accomplish.
keywords: pad thai recipe, homemade pad thai, thai recipes, homemade asian recipes, pad thai noodles, pad thai sauce, shrimp noodles, chinese recipes homemade, thai recipes homemade, pad thai without tamarind
